title: Forces - block masses 4M on incline and M vertical

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Two blocks are connected by a string that passes over an ideal pulley, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> of mass <math alttext="4 M" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>M</mi></math> can move with negligible friction along an incline that makes an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> with the horizontal, and Block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> can move vertically. The blocks are released from rest from the positions shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. (a) The dots in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> represent blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, as indicated, and the dashed line represents the surface of the incline. On each dot, draw and label the forces (not components) exerted on the blocks. Each force must be represented by a distinct arrow starting on, and pointing away from, the appropriate dot.
